results.question: When is revenue recognized?
gold_answer: Revenue is recognized when, or as, performance obligations under terms of a contract are satisfied, which occurs when control of the promised service is transferred to a customer.
results.markdown_table_response: The revenue recognized by the Company is based on the total revenue from the contract including the revenue for each performance obligation and any other revenue derived from the transaction price. The Company recognizes revenue based on the transaction price only if the performance obligation is satisfied and no other revenue is derived from the transaction price. If revenue from the transaction price is not recognized, the revenue is treated as a non-revenue event in which a payment to a customer occurs either significantly before or significantly after the performance obligation is satisfied. The revenue from the transaction price is not recognized if the performance obligation is satisfied and the customer does not pay the transaction price.
results.csv_string_response:
Revenue is recognized when, or as, performance obligations under terms of a contract are satisfied, which occurs when control of the promised service is transferred to a customer. Revenue is measured as the amount of the transaction price that is allocated to the respective performance obligation when, or as, the performance obligation is satisfied. results.question: What led to lower capital expenditures at Bell Media in 2019?
gold_answer: production equipment and IT upgrades in 2018
results.markdown_table_response:
Bell Media capital expenditures totaled $3,988  million for the year, up $17 million over 2018. This corresponds to a capital intensity ratio of 16.6%, down 0.3 pts compared to last year. Capital spending in the year reflected the following:
• Greater capital investments in our wireless segment of $33 million in 2019, compared to 2018, as we advanced the build-out of our LTE-A network, continued to deploy wireless small-cells to expand capacity to support subscriber growth and increase network speeds, coverage and signal quality, as well as to expand data fibre backhaul in preparation for 5G technology
• A modest reduction in capital spending in our wireline segment of $10 million in 2019, compared to last year, as we continued to focus our investments on the ongoing deployment of FTTP to more homes and businesses, the roll-out of fixed WTTP to rural locations in Ontario and Québec, the connection of fibre Internet and TV services to more homes and businesses and the execution of business customer contracts
• Lower capital expenditures at Bell Media of $6 million in 2019, compared to 2018, mainly due to production equipment and IT upgrades in 2018

results.question: How much did net sales change between 2017 and 2018?
results.csv_string_response:
The table below sets forth the estimated change in net sales for our Film and Electrolytic reportable segment for the fiscal years 2018 and 2017 (amounts in thousands):
(1) Fiscal years ending March 31, 2018 and 2017 adjusted due to the adoption of ASC 606
Net Sales
Film and Electrolytic net sales of $202.0 million in fiscal year 2018 increased $19.7 million or 10.8% from $182.2 million in fiscal year 2017. The increase in net sales was primarily driven by an increase in net sales in the distributor channel across all the APAC and EMEA regions of $13.7 million, a $3.3 million increase in net sales in the OEM channel of the EMEA region and a $4.2 million increase in the EMS channel across the Americas, EMEA, and APAC regions. These increases were partially offset by a decrease in net sales of $1.2 million in the OEM channel across the Americas, APAC, and JPKO regions. In addition, there was a favorable impact of $7.6 million from foreign currency exchange primarily due to the change in the value of the Euro compared to the U.S. dollar.
